details.title: COVID-19 HIGHLIGHTS | Delhi government directs hospitals to put up flex boards to encourage plasma donation
details.content: The Delhi government on Tuesday directed state-run and private hospitals in the national capital to put up flex boards to encourage people who have recovered from COVID-19 to donate plasma to help other patients. The boards have to be put up at the gate of all hospitals, the city government said in an order. (READ THE FULL HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: Story of lockdown woes from Bihar
details.content:
Muzaffarpur: Children studying in government schools are allegedly not being provided with mid-day meals as promised by state govt, in view of closure of schools due to #COVID19. A parent says,"Mid-day meal is not being provided, govt has not done anything on this yet." #Bihar pic.twitter.com/ijIjni0moR

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: Coronavirus: Railway Police ASI tests positive, 69 cases in South Western Railway
details.content: A 47-year-old Assistant Sub Inspector of the Government Railway Police, working at the KSR Bengaluru railway station tested COVID-positive on Tuesday. The railway police station on Platform 6 of the station was sealed for sanitization on Tuesday and all 60 cops asked to remain home quarantined. He is the first railway cop to test positive for the virus. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 positive patient escapes from MP hospital
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh: A person who was sent to Gwalior Central Jail on charges of theft had tested positive for #COVID19. He managed to escape from hospital by dodging guards. Manoj Sahu, Superintendent said,"Two police guards who were on duty have been suspended for negligence." (7.7) pic.twitter.com/SuiHHeA7OR

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: News from Karnataka's Kalaburagi
details.content: Kalaburagi district administration restricted marriages at public places, convention halls and at homes, in view COVID-19. Deputy Commissioner issued a notification that no permission should be given to marriages except at sub-registrar office in presence of only five signatories.

details.title: Update from Rajasthan
details.content: State government directs private schools not to charge fees till they reopen. On April 9 state government had directed private schools to not take advance fee for three months (till June 30), in view of COVID-19 pandemic: School Education Department, Rajasthan Government.

details.title: Lockdown notification in Cuttack
details.content:
It is hereby ordered to shutdown the entire Cuttack city (CMC area) till midnight of 10 July. Weekend shutdown restrictions will also apply to Cuttack city (CMC area) on July 11&12 as per previous order: Cuttack Municipal Corporation (CMC), Odisha #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/6KMHlpVvXu

— ANI (@ANI) July 7, 2020

details.title: No lockdown in Shillong
details.content: There are rumours and fake news that there is a lockdown in Shillong from July 10th; I would like to clarify that the Government of Meghalaya has taken no such decision: Chief Minister Conrad Sangma.

details.title: Latest Assam numbers
details.content: 814 new COVID-19 cases detected on Tuesday, 588 from Guwahati city, taking the total number of cases to 13336 including 8329 discharged cases, 4988 active cases and 16 deaths: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: Six new cases in Himachal
details.content: Himachal Pradesh reported six new COVID-19 cases and 27 recoveries on Tueaday. Total number of cases rise to 1083 including 282 active cases, 777 recoveries and nine deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: 'Unlock 2.0' guidelines for Ladakh region
details.content:
Chairman District Disaster Management Authority/District Magistrate, Leh issues an order regarding ‘Unlock 2.0’; All Private/Commercial Vehicles (except public transport) shall be permitted to ply on all days without any restrictions: Dept of Info&Public Relations, Leh. #Ladakh pic.twitter.com/eVWjcrD9N7

— ANI (@ANI) July 7, 2020

details.title: 24 new cases in Tripura
details.content: Out of 1378 samples tested for COVID-19, 24 people have tested positive in the state: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb.

details.title: Important news from Bihar
details.content: Patna Medical College has withdrawn the order that stated deployment of six doctors, three nurses, and a ventilator at the official residence of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

details.title: 141 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: Jharkhand records 141 new COVID-19 cases and two deaths Tuesday, taking the total number of cases to 3018. The death toll stands at 22: State Health Department.

Considering emergency&unmet medical need for COVID. Central Drugs Standard Control Org has approved Restricted Emergency Use of Remdesivir injectable formulation for treatrnent of patients with severe COVID19 infection subject to conditions& restrictions:Drugs Controller General pic.twitter.com/4m1Qn7uK1S

— ANI (@ANI) July 7, 2020

details.title: Five day lockdown in Odisha's Ganjam district
details.content: Five-day complete shutdown in all urban areas and five block headquarters of Ganjam (9-13 July), essential services to continue. Screening and other measures to be done in all NACs, Hinjilicut municipality,all block headquarters and Berhampur Municipality from 9-13 July due to rising cases: Ganjam Collector.

details.title: Drugs Controller General writes to states/UTs
details.content: Drugs Controller General in a letter to Drugs Controller of all States/UTs has requested them to instruct their enforcement officials to keep strict vigil on the matter to prevent the black-marketing and sale of the drug Remdesivir Injection above MRP.

details.title: News on Bengal lockdown
details.content:
Current concept of containment zone may be combined with the current concept of buffer zone, and together, they may constitute a revised and broad-based containment zone approach: West Bengal's Additional Chief Secretary, Home, Alapan Bandyopadhyay https://t.co/94plashB39

— ANI (@ANI) July 7, 2020

details.title: Now Mumbaikars can do COVID-19 tests at private labs with doctors' prescriptions
details.content: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) amends its COVID-19 testing guidelines, allows people to undergo COVID testing at private labs without any doctor's prescription, issues a list of 17 private labs where they can avail this facility.

details.title: WATCH | COVID-19 infected Hyd doc slapped with bill of 1 lakh for a day, cries for help
Close to 2.7 lakh samples were tested in last 24 hours
details.content: A total of 1,04,73,771 samples tested for COVID-19 till date. Of these, 2,62,679 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR).

details.title: WATCH | Worst-hit ‘unlocked’ European countries saw fewer COVID-19 cases than India: Study
70 per cent of active COVID-19 cases by June-end were from just five states: Data
details.content: On June 1, five states — Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh — together reported nearly 63% of the total active Covid-19 cases in the country. By the end of Unlock-1, the percentage had gone up to 70. (READ THE FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Six Gujarat HC staffers test positive
details.content: Gujarat High Court to remain closed from today till 10th July for sanitisation of the entire premises after six staff members of the High Court registry and one constable from Vigilance Department were found COVID-19 positive.

details.title: Karnataka CM holds emergency Cabinet meeting
details.content:
Bengaluru: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa holds an emergency meeting with Deputy CM Dr Ashwath Narayan & other ministers over #COVID19 situation in state.

Total number of positive cases in Karnataka stands at 26,815 including 11,098 recovered & 416 deaths, as per the last bulletin. pic.twitter.com/ZJhILP3all

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: Over 20,000 cases in India for sixth consecutive day
details.content: India reports a spike of 22,752 new COVID-19 cases and 482 deaths in the last 24 hours. Positive cases stand at 7,42,417 including 2,64,944 active cases, 4,56,831 cured/discharged/migrated and 20,642 deaths: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare.

details.title: 'Covaxin' human trial to begin at Patna AIIMS from July 10
details.content: After getting permission from the ICMR, all mandatory preparation to begin the human-trials have been completed within a very short time frame at the Patna –AIIMS. Speaking to TNIE, Superintendent of AIIMS Dr CM Singh said that the human-trails will begin here from July 10 under the constant monitoring of doctors following the guidelines of ICMR. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Master Blaster pads up again, this time for another cause
details.content:
Mumbai: Former cricketer and legendary batsman Sachin Tendulkar today inaugurated a plasma donation center at Seven Hills Hospital, for the treatment of #COVID19 patients. #Maharashtra pic.twitter.com/DFyB2ACvEG

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: Delhi government to probe all COVID-19 deaths in national capital
details.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has directed state Health Secretary to share a detailed analysis of factors behind all COVID-19 deaths in the capital in the last two weeks. The objective is to take measures to further reduce deaths in the national capital.

Kerala: People buy goods & vegetables at shops & markets in Thiruvananthapuram, amid 'Triple lockdown' (more restrictions) imposed in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation area for a week, starting July 6. State government has given relaxation for shops; to open from 7-11 am. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/d5fr4Pzhlr

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: Chennai's positivity rate comes down
details.content:
Chennai’s positivity rate on July 7 plummeted to 11.87 % while total positivity rate has come from 24.2 % in June to 18.2 % in July.

City recorded 1203 cases on July 7 and 10,139 tests were done, Municipal Administration Minister @SPVelumanicbe says.@xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) July 8, 2020

#Keralites testing +ive for #COVID19 at other states. A report of @KeralaHealth says that while taking107 such cases, it analyzed 96 cases & it turned out that 90 have not contracted the virus in Kerala. But a possibility is there in the case of 6 @xpresskerala @NewIndianXpress

details.content:
Monuments should be opened in consultation with the state governments and following #COVID19 precautions. Today, around 800 monuments including Taj Mahal are still closed but we have to resume work soon: Union Minister of Tourism and Culture Prahlad Singh Patel pic.twitter.com/Q8lJy8QgAm

- 18 had two or more COVID related complications
- 14 had a travel history & 8 had no travel history

details.title: Delhi deaths to be probed
details.content:
• Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has sought a detailed analytical report from the Delhi government's health secretary on factors responsible for COVID-19 deaths in the city in the last fortnight, officials said.
  • Delhi reported 736 deaths in the last two weeks, with 397 people succumbing to the disease in the first week of July.
  • Officials said the objective of seeking the report is to take all possible measures to reduce coronavirus deaths in the national capital.
  • A total of 3,165 COVID-19 deaths have occurred in Delhi so far.

Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh District Administration orders opening of footbridges connecting India and Nepal at Dharchula, Jauljibi and Jhulaghat from today till 10 July for Nepal nationals who are receiving pension in India. Health screening and social distancing to be ensured. pic.twitter.com/4Jw7HjKSF2

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: Puducherry Raj Nivas sealed for 48 hours
details.content: Puducherry Raj Nivas being disinfected and will remain closed for 48 hours after a staff member tested positive for COVID-19 today. The member has no access to Lt Guv. As precaution, Lt Guv and staff attached to her personal office are being tested today: Puducherry Lt Guv's Secretariat.

details.title: Government doctor succumbs to COVID-19 in Guntur, 40 staff at hospital tested
details.content: The doctor was working at the a government hospital in the district and tested positive one week ago. Officials said a resident of the apartment complex where the doctor was staying tested positive recently. Tests of the resident's contacts were conducted during which the doctor also tested positive. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Jharkhand CM under scanner after cabinet colleague, MLA test positive for Covid-19
details.content: Hemant Soren is under scanner for Covid-19 as one of his Cabinet colleagues Mithlesh Thakur and JMM MLA Mathura Mahto were tested positive for coronavirus on Tuesday. Soren, along with his Principal Secretary and Press Advisor, has put himself in home quarantine as they had come in contact with Thakur and Mahto recently. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 15-year-old Udupi boy kills himself after not being allowed to go out due to quarantine
details.content: A 15-year-old boy from Gundmi near Saligrama in Udupi district who was under home quarantine allegedly killed himself on Monday. He was found hanging from the ceiling in his house.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Patna to observe 7-day lockdown from July 10 as Covid-19 cases spike
details.content: Keeping in view the growing number of coronavirus cases, the Bihar government has announced a seven-day lockdown in the capital city from July 10. The district administration took this decision after 235 Covid-19 positive cases reported from the city on Wednesday. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Dosas, fish, flowers: Sex workers look to other means of livelihood amid COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: The pandemic has most definitely brought hardships to the unorganised sector in Karnataka -- and that includes sex workers. With no help from the state government, sex workers are now looking at other means of sustaining themselves. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Coimbatore sweet shop selling special mysurpak as 'COVID-19 cure' sealed
details.content: A sweet shop selling 'special mysurpak' with 19 herbal ingredients claiming that it would cure coronavirus in just three days was sealed on Wednesday by Food Safety Department officials. The shop owner had put out advertisements through pamphlets, saying that the 'photo speed corona cure mysurpak' with 19 herbs would cure COVID-19 patients in three days and a daily consumption by others would boost their immunity. (READ MORE)

For class XII students in Tamil Nadu, who could not write their board exam on March 24, re-exam will be onducted on July 27, at their own school: School Education Minister @KASengottaiyan @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress #covid19lockdown pic.twitter.com/aTpkvmNuqD

— S Mannar Mannan (@mannar_mannan) July 8, 2020

details.title: Spike in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru, Hyderabad causes concern
details.content: The sharp spurt in the number of coronavirus cases in Bengaluru and Hyderabad since relaxations in lockdown curbs last month is causing concern for managers of the two southern cities. In the first seven days of this month alone, Bengaluru has added over 6,800 cases while the Telangana capital more than 9,000 infections with officials attributing it largely to movement of people consequent to easing of restrictions.

details.title: Gujarat records highest single-day spike of 783 COVID-19 cases
details.content: Gujarat reported 783 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, the highest single-day spike, taking the count to 38,419, while the death toll inched towards the 2,000-mark, the state health department said. The state reported the death of 16 coronavirus patients, taking the total fatalities to 1,995, it said.

details.title: The doubling time for COVID-19 cases data in Chennai may indicate low transmission
details.content: The data on the doubling time for COVID-19 cases in the city, especially in the zones including Royapuram and Tondiarpet, may indicate that the transmission is low in several areas in the city which were earlier considered a challenge by the state government and the city corporation.

details.title: COVID victim cremated by another's family as 2 bodies swapped at AIIMS
details.content: Moments before the body of 35-year-old Anjum was to be buried, Sharif Khan decided to have one last look at his sister who succumbed to the novel coronavirus. However, he received a rude shock when the corpse lying in a body bag beside the freshly dug grave turned out to be someone else's. (READ MORE)

details.title: Spicejet offers COVID-19 hospitalisation insurance to passengers
details.content:
SpiceJet passengers can now avail an insurance cover for COVID-19 hospitalisation by paying a minimum premium of Rs 443, the airline said on Wednesday. "This insurance has no restrictions on room or ICU rent. This implies there is no limit on ICU charges or room rent until the insured sum lasts," it said.

SpiceJet flight (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Assam sees record one-day jump of six coronavirus deaths
details.content: Assam on Wednesday reported its highest number of COVID-19 deaths in a single day as six people succumbed to the disease, taking the coronavirus toll to 22 while the tally reached 13,336, Health minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

details.title: Ambulance charges Rs 8,000 for a 7-kilometer ride, case registered
details.content: The Pune district administration on Wednesday filed a case against an ambulanceservice provider in the city for overcharging a COVID-19 patient. The ambulance service charged a patient Rs 8,000 for a seven-km ride on June 25, said District Collector Naval Kishore Ram.

details.title: Indian Navy completes Operation Samudra Setu by repatriating nearly 4,000 Indians from 3 countries
details.content: The Indian Navy on Wednesday said it has completed Operation Samudra Setu, which began on May 5, by bringing nearly 4,000 Indians back home from three countries amid the coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: Delirium, rare brain inflammation, stroke linked to COVID-19 complications: Study
details.content: Neurological complications of COVID-19 may include delirium, brain inflammation, stroke, and nerve damage, according to a study which says some of these symptoms may not be a direct consequence of the novel coronavirus infection but due to the immune system acting on healthy cells. (READ MORE)

details.title: Pune district adds record 1,618 COVID-19 cases; 25 more die
details.content: Pune district reported 1,618 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours - highest single-day spike - taking the count to 32,596 on Wednesday, while 25 more patients died due to the infection, a health official said. The death toll reached 944 with 25 more patients succumbing to the infection during the same period, he said.

details.title: Strict lockdown in Bengal from Thursday 5 pm as state reports highest single-day spike of nearly 1,000 COVID-19 cases
details.content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee attributed the surging coronavirus cases to the rise in the number of laboratories testing samples of suspected COVID-19 patients. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Close to 2.7 lakh samples were tested on Wednesday
details.content: A total of 1,07,40,832 samples tested for COVID-19 till 8th July. Of these, 2,67,061 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR).

details.title: Case against ambulance provider in Pune for overcharging a patient
details.content: FIR registered against Pune Sanjeevani ambulance services at Bibvewadi police station on a complaint by RTO (Regional Transport Office), Pune for overcharging a patient. Case registered under section 420 of IPC: Pune City Police.

Kerala: 25 Commandos of Special Armed Police (SAP) deployed in Poonthura to enforce lockdown guidelines. details.title: Nearly 700 new cases in Assam in last 24 hours
details.content: 696 new COVID-19 cases detected on Wednesday, 423 from Guwahati city. Total number of cases rise to 14032 including  8726 discharged cases, 5281 active cases and 22 deaths: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: 78 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: 78 new COVID-19 positive cases and 66 recoveries have been reported in Jharkhand on Wednesday. Total number of cases rise to 3134 including 2170 recovered/discharged cases: State Health Department.

details.title: CSIR DG on COVID being airbourne
details.content:
There is emerging evidence in world that when we speak, we emit aerosols-less than 5 microns in size. Since they are small, they remain suspended in the air. So in crowded places, even a single infected person can potentially pass infection to many others: CSIR DG Shekhar Mande pic.twitter.com/cFaJkFXXpv

— ANI (@ANI) July 8, 2020

details.title: India registers its highest daily case count in last 24 hours

details.title: GoM meeting starts under chairmanship of Union Health Minister
details.content:
Delhi: Group of Ministers (GoM) meeting under the chairmanship of Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on #COVID19, is underway, through video conferencing. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar & Union Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri also present. pic.twitter.com/yKBmS0FPPI

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

A family travelling to Malaysia takes necessary precautions before boarding their flight from the Chennai International Airport.
Express Photo | @ashwinacharya05 #COVID19 @xpresstn @shibasahu2012 pic.twitter.com/iS0cc9cxIb

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 9, 2020

details.title: PM Modi addresses Varanasi. Here is what he has to say on COVID-19 situation in India
details.content:
• This is the month of Sawan, in such a situation speaking with the people from Varanasi seems like a visit to Lord Bholenath. This is the blessing of Lord Bholenath that even during COVID-19 crisis, our Varanasi is filled with enthusiasm.
  • 100 years ago, a similar pandemic happened, it is said that back then the population was not this big in India. Even then, at that time, India was one of the countries which had the most deaths.
  • That is why whole world was concerned for India this time. Experts were raising questions on India, saying this time also the situation will get worse but what happened? Uttar Pradesh, a state with population 23-24 crores, with support of its people overcame all these apprehensions.

details.title: Delhi government comes up with 'Nodal Officer' system to coordinate 'Plasma Donation' efforts
details.content:
The Nodal Officer will provide voluntary plasma donor including replacement donors keeping in view the projected requirement of Convalescent plasma and the scarce availability of this meagre resource: Delhi Govt #COVID19 https://t.co/LTKPFgiLiT

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Centre to come up with database of tribal migrant workers for livelihood generation amid pandemic
details.content: The decision was communicated to states. However, the process to collate data from states has been challenging so far and the progress on it has been slow, said an official of the Ministry of Tribal Affairs. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: PM Modi hails UP's efforts against COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: A huge country like Brazil, with a similar population to Uttar Pradesh, has suffered around 65,000 deaths due to COVID-19. While in Uttar Pradesh, around 800 people have lost their lives, it means many lives have been saved in the state: Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

details.title: Puducherry L-G Kiran Bedi tests negative for COVID-19
details.content: Health Minister Maddi Krishna Rao said, 'COVID-19 tests were done for 37 people in the Raj Nivas out of which one person working in the IT wing has tested positive.' (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Union HRD Minister on CBSE cutting key chapters in Social sciences and economics
details.content:
Exclusions are a 1-time measure for exams due to #COVID19. While it's easy to misconstrue exclusion of 3-4 topics like nationalism, local govt, federalism & build a concocted narrative,a wider perusal of different subjects will show that this is happening across subjects: HRD Min https://t.co/oxyPwAasl4

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: 49 new cases in Puducherry; death toll climbs to 16 after two more people succumb to COVID-19
details.content: All the 49 new cases are in Puducherry region, said Minister for Health Malladi Krishna Rao. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Tamil Nadu news bulletin
details.content:
WATCH | A brief news bulletin from the Tamil Nadu bureau of The New Indian Express.

Scroll the thread for detailed stories.@NewIndianXpress @SushmithaRam pic.twitter.com/HmEVECNSgF

— TNIE Tamil Nadu (@xpresstn) July 9, 2020

details.title: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan downplays COVID-19 fears
details.content:
• During our discussions today, experts again stated that there is no community transmission in India. There may be some localised pockets where transmission is high but as a country, there's no community transmission.
  • We are seeing on TV that India has become the third most COVID-19 affected country. It is necessary to see this in correct perspective, we are a country with the second highest population in the world. Our cases per million are 538, while world average is 1,453.

details.title: No award ceremonies in Andhra
details.content:
#AndhraPradesh govt cancels all awards for 2019-20 fiscal due to difficulties arising out of #COVIDー19 @xpressandhra @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/cIM89hgZIk

— Viswanath (@Viswanath_TNIE) July 9, 2020

details.title: Himachal tally crosses 1100
details.content: Number of COVID-19 cases reaches 1101 in Himachal Pradesh, active cases stand at 256. Total 821 patients have recovered so far. Death toll stands at nine.

details.title: Update from Karnataka
details.content: Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa calls State Ministers, MPs, MLAs and Corporators from Bengaluru for a meeting at Palace Grounds to discuss COVID-19 management in the city.

details.title: Arrested Assam activist Akhil Gogoi tests positive for COVID-19, says his legal counsel
details.content: Arrested Assam activist Akhil Gogoi has tested positive for COVID-19, his legal counsel Santanu Barthakur said on Thursday. “He has tested positive. I just received the news that he has tested positive for COVID-19,” Barthakur told The New Indian Express. It, however, could not be officially confirmed. (READ MORE)

details.title: 166 new COVID-19 cases in Aurangabad, dist tally reaches 7,504
details.content: The number of coronavirus cases rose to 7,504 in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district on Thursday after 166 more people tested positive for the disease, officials said. Among the fresh cases, 101 were reported from the city and 65 from rural parts of the district.

details.title: ITDC signs MoU with AIIMS to strengthen COVID-19 protocols for its properties
details.content: The ITDC has signed an MoU with the AIIMS to strengthen health protocols and monitor the COVID-19 preventive practices across all its properties, including hotels, a statement from the PSU under the tourism ministry said on Thursday.

details.title: Seven more COVID-19 deaths in Rajasthan
details.content: Rajasthan reported seven more COVID-19 deaths and 149 fresh cases of coronavirus infection on Thursday, taking the death toll to 489 and total tally to 22,212, officials said. There are 4,846 active cases in the state. While three deaths were reported in Pali, two were in Jodhpur, one each in Nagaur and Udaipur.

details.title: Panic buying ensues in Bengal markets ahead of lockdown in containment zones
details.content: People resorted to panic buying in several markets of West Bengal on Thursday disregarding social distancing norms, ahead of the imposition of a total lockdown in the containment zones in the state.

details.title: Latest Andhra numbers
details.content:
#COVIDUpdates: Of 16,882 samples tested in last 24 hrs till Thursday 9 am, 1555 (AP-1500, other states-53, FR-2) tested positive; 13 deaths reported taking toll to 277.@NewIndianXpress@Kalyan_TNIE @ArogyaAndhra #APFightsCorona pic.twitter.com/QwYE1MOrei

— TNIE Andhra Pradesh (@xpressandhra) July 9, 2020

details.title: PM Modi addresses again, this time in India Global Week 2020
details.content:
• India remains one of the most open economies in the world. We are laying a red carpet for all global companies to come and establish their presence in India. Very few countries will offer the kind of opportunities India does today. Vaccines made in India are responsible for 2/3rd of the vaccine needs of the world's children.
  • Today also our companies are active in international efforts for development and production of COVID-19 vaccine. I'm certain that India will have an important role in developing and in scaling up production of the vaccine once it is discovered.
  • The pandemic has once again shown that India's pharma industry is an asset not just for India but for the entire world. It has played a leading role in reducing the cost of medicines, especially for developing countries.
  • When India talks of revival it's revival with care, with compassion, which is sustainable both for environment and economy. Indians have the spirit to achieve what is believed to be impossible. No wonder that in India, we are already seeing green-shoots of economic recovery In these times, it is natural to talk about revival.
  • It is equally natural to link global revival and India. There is faith that the story of global revival will have India playing a leading role World over, you have seen the contribution of India's talent-force.
  • Who can forget the Indian tech industry and tech professionals. They have been showing the way for decades. India is a power-house of talent that is eager to contribute.

details.title: Calcutta HC to remain closed for three days
details.content: Judicial and administrative works at Calcutta High Court to remain suspended from 10th July to 13th July, to conduct sanitisation in the three buildings of the Court.

details.title: Government's statement on COVID-19 situation in India
details.content: The global comparison between the five most affected countries clearly depicted that India has one of the lowest cases per million (538) and deaths per million (15) compared the global average of 1453 and 68.7, respectively: Government of India.

details.title: WATCH | Story of a cab driver's grit amid pandemic times
details.content:
From cab driver to vegetable vendor: This taxi driver in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi didn't want to give up amid #COVID19 lockdown that he decided to sell vegetables in his vehicle in Alangulam.
Express video | V Karthikalagu. @xpresstn @shibasahu2012 pic.twitter.com/kkfoHvlrLZ

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 9, 2020

details.title: HC directs Delhi University to give schedule of final year UG exams
details.content: The Delhi High Court Thursday directed Delhi University to file an affidavit detailing the schedule of final year undergraduate exams which have been postponed from July 10 to beyond August 15. (READ MORE)

details.title: 8-day 'total lockdown' in Assam's Golaghat town from Thursday evening
details.content: The Assam government has decided to impose a "total lockdown" in Golaghat town from Thursday evening for eight days to curb the spread of the coronavirus disease. The restrictions in Golaghat Municipal Board area will be in place from 7 pm on Thursday to prevent further spread of the virus, he said.

details.title: Eight states account for 90 pc active coronavirus cases in India: GoM on COVID-19 informed
details.content: Eight states, including Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Karnataka and Telangana, account for around 90 per cent of the active COVID-19 cases in the country and 80 per cent of the active cases have been reported from 49 districts, the Group of Ministers (GoM) on COVID-19 was informed on Thursday.

details.title: Odisha reports highest single-day spike of 577 COVID-19 cases; tally reaches 11,201
details.content: Odisha on Thursday reported its highest single-day spike of 577 COVID-19 cases, taking the tally in the state to 11,201, while four more deaths pushed the toll to 52, a health department official said. Ganjam district reported three deaths and Bhadrak one, he said.

details.title: Delhi Police ASI dies after testing positive for COVID-19
details.content: A 53-year-old assistant sub-inspector of Delhi Police died on Thursday morning at a hospital here, weeks after he tested positive for COVID-19, officials said. Jeevan Singh, posted at Delhi Police's Special branch, was attached with the Motor Transport section of the department, they said.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath asks officials to ramp up testing in state
details.content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday directed that 40,000 tests should be conducted in the state per day to trace the spread of coronavirus. Around 35,000 tests are being conducted per day in the state till now. With COVID-19 cases rising in Jhansi, Kanpur and Varanasi, the chief minister said a team of specialists doctors should be sent to the three districts.

details.title: Delhi couple was caught visiting Dharamshala by producing fake COVID-19 negative certificates
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh: A Delhi couple was caught visiting Dharamshala by producing fake #COVID19 negative certificates. Kangra SP says, "Sent them to institutional quarantine center, they'll be tested today. Case registered against them. Action will be taken according to their report" pic.twitter.com/27P8vPny0d

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Telangana now using rapid antibody kits to boost its low COVID-19 testing capacity
details.content: In a major development that will help Telangana increase its COVID-19 testing capacity which is one of the lowest in the country, the state has started using Rapid Antibody Test (RAT) kits. (READ MORE)

details.title: Thousands of Indian students planning to study abroad set to miss the bus this year
details.content: Covid-19 pandemic seems to have derailed the dreams of thousands of Indians looking to pursue undergraduate and postgraduate degrees abroad this year. (READ MORE)

details.title: Bihar reports 704 new COVID-19 positive cases today
details.content: Bihar reports 704 new #COVID19 positive cases today, taking the total number of cases to 13,978. Number of recovered cases stand at 9,541: State Health Department

details.title: We're considering to increase number of labs, technicians: Karnataka Health Minister
details.content:
We've 72 labs where #COVID19 tests are conducted. They are under pressure with increased number of tests. When lab technicians are quarantined, it gets difficult to complete work. So we're considering to increase number of labs&technicians: B Sriramulu, Karnataka Health Minister pic.twitter.com/yhRWzCThNT

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Here's list of contained wards under Tirupati municipality
details.content:
#COVIDUpdates: With increasing number of #coronavirus cases, #Chittoor district administration declared #Tirumala as #containmentzone. Here's list of contained wards under #Tirupati municipality.@NewIndianXpress#APfightsCorona pic.twitter.com/FQYiGWS4Ux

— TNIE Andhra Pradesh (@xpressandhra) July 9, 2020

details.content:

— Tanmay Das (@tanmay__das) July 9, 2020

details.content: In the last 24 hours, 1,248 new #COVID19 positive cases have been reported. Active cases in the State stand at 10,373. A total of 21,127 have been discharged after recovering from the disease. The death toll stands at 862: Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan Prasad

Coimbatore South #MLA Amman K Arjunan, who was tested positive for #COVID19 on Sunday, discharged from ESI Hospital on Thursday. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/dUWVZGUc9i

details.title: Eight Senior IAS officers deputed to supervise COVID cases
details.content:
Eight Senior IAS officers are deputed to supervise covid cases, one officer per zone in BBMP limits @NewIndianXpress @santwana99 @WeAreBangalore pic.twitter.com/u5C9G7MDSG

— Ashwini M Sripad (@AshwiniMS_TNIE) July 9, 2020

details.title: Two BSF jawans test positive for COVID-19 in Mizoram
details.content: Two BSF jawans have tested positive for COVID-19 in Mizoram's Serchhip district in the last 24 hours, pushing the tally in the state to 203, an official said on Thursday. The jawans had recently returned from Dholcherra in neighbouring Assam. (READ MORE)

details.title: No benefit of COVID-19 vaccine if it is made after 2 years: Dr Nivedita Gupta
details.content:
No benefit of #COVIDー19 vaccine if it is made after 2 years; our restlessness is to make it available at the earliest, says Dr Nivedita Gupta of @ICMRDELHI on DG's letter to 12 trial sites for #CovaxinVaccine @NewIndianXpress#COVID19Pandemic

— Sumi Dutta (@SumiSukanya) July 9, 2020

details.content:
- Swapna Suresh, the key accused in the gold smuggling case, claims innocence
- Chennithala launches another attack on Pinarayi over the gold smuggling case
- Cop tests #COVID +ve in T'puram@Pooja170P brings the major news updates from Kerala@NewIndianXpress @MSKiranPrakash pic.twitter.com/AaG4O6DZRk

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) July 9, 2020

details.title: India has been able to manage COVID-19 relatively well:  Rajesh Bhushan
details.content: We are the second-most populous country of the world. Despite a population of 1.3 Billion people, India has been able to manage COVID-19 relatively well. If you look at cases per million population it still remains amongst lowest in the world: Rajesh Bhushan, OSD, Ministry of Health

details.title: We have 15 deaths per million population whereas we have countries where it is 40 times as much: Rajesh Bhushan
details.content: Today we have 538 cases per mn population, it's as per WHO situation report. Case per mn population in some countries are at least 16-17 times more than what it is in India. We have 15 deaths per mn population whereas we have countries where it is 40 times as much: Rajesh Bhushan

When we talk of case load of #COVID19 in India, it is 2,69,000 people. This tells us that at the end of the day we've managed a situation where our health care infrastructure is not unduly burdened&is not creaking due to the pressure: Rajesh Bhushan, OSD, Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/09suvKLOEu

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: We are testing more than 2.6 Lakhs of samples per day: ICMR Senior scientist
details.content: The number of tests has increased, on an average, we are testing more than 2.6 Lakhs of samples per day. We hope to see a further rise by the use of the antigen test: ICMR Senior scientist Nivedita Gupta

A team led by Health Ministry's additional Secretary Arti Ahuja inspect a quarantined street in Chennai's Otteri, where 24 have tested #COVID19 positive.
Express photos | @Jawahar_TNIE.@shibasahu2012 @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/urAb50Jy5X

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 9, 2020

details.title: COVID-19: This Odisha man spreads awareness by revamping damaged bikes
Ministers to be appointed as in-charge for each zone in Bengaluru for COVID management
details.content: Amid spike in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru, Chief Minister B S Yediyurappa on Thursday decided to appoint ministers as in-charge for each zone in the city, aimed at effectively managing the pandemic.

details.title: High Court stays Karnataka government's order banning online classes
details.content: The Karnataka High Court has stayed the Karnataka government's order banning conduct of online classes by schools stating that banning it encroaches upon the Fundamental Right to Life and Education.

details.title: 87-yr-old woman, her nonagenarian husband in Delhi defeat COVID-19
details.content: An octogenarian woman in Delhi and her 90-year-old husband suffering from Alzheimer's disease have recovered from the coronavirus infection and discharged from hospital. Doctors at a city hospital where the elderly couple were treated said that their recovery from COVID-19 in the face of high mortality rate in the older population globally due to the infection is a ray of hope to other patients.

details.title: Tripura's COVID-19 tally rises to 1774 with 57 new cases
details.content: Tripura reported 57 fresh cases of COVID-19, raising the state's tally to 1,774, officials said on Thursday. Of the fresh cases, 22 were reported from Gomati district, 10 each from Sepahijala and Tripura West, nine from Khowai, five from Tripura North and one from Tripura South, they said. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID innovation by railway engineer: device in pocket to remind people of social distancing
details.content: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, a Southern Railway Signal & Telecommunication engineer has developed a device to remind people to maintain at least a three metre distance from each other. The device can fit into a pocket or a small purse, can be attached with ID cards and can also be used along with a wristwatch.

details.title: Involve citizens in fight against coronavirus in Maharashtra: CM Uddhav Thackeray
details.content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said all cities in the state should set up 'corona vigilance committees',to involve participation of citizens in the fight against COVID-19 and help the local administration in monitoring the ground situation.

details.title: District Judge of Karkardooma District Court tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: District and Sessions Judge of Karkardooma District courts complex has tested positive for COVID-19, said a circular on Thursday. According to the circular issued by Administrative Officer Renu Sharma, District Judge Deepak Jagotra tested positive for COVID-19 contagion on July 8 and has gone into home quarantine for 14 days.

details.title: COVID-19 situation in Delhi shows 'remarkable' improvement: MHA
details.content: With a recovery rate of over 72 per cent and doubling rate of nearly 30 days, the COVID-19 situation in the national capital has shown remarkable improvement in recent days, the Union Home Ministry said Thursday.

details.title: Indore COVID-19 crosses 5000-mark, death toll reaches 255
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district rose to 5,043 after 45 more people tested positive for the disease in last 24 hours, a health official said on Thursday.

details.title: Meghalaya's COVID-19 case load crosses 100-mark
details.content: Meghalaya's COVID-19 caseload crossed the 100-mark on Thursday with five more persons testing positive for the infection, officials said. Two of the new patients are BSF personnel. The northeastern state's virus count now stands at 104, they said.

details.title: Central team visits COVID-19 facilities in TN, holds discussion with Minister
details.content: A central team led by a senior official of the Union Health and Family Welfare department reviewed the pandemic situation in the city on Thursday. Led by Additional Secretary of union health and family welfare department Aarti Ahuja, the team held discussions with state Health Minister Dr C Vijaya Baskar and senior officials.

details.title: 395 policemen have tested positive in Bengaluru since outbreak of COVID-19
details.content: Bringing to the fore the dangers frontline workers face in combating the deadly coronavirus, 395 policemen have tested positive for the infection since the outbreak of the pandemic in Bengaluru. This includes five deaths, Inspector General of Police and Additional Commissioner of Police (Administration) Hemant Nimbalkar told.

details.title: SC dismisses plea on claim about therapy to deal with COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: The Supreme Court Thursday refused to entertain a plea which claimed that Soap Aroma Aerosol Action Preventive Therapy (SAAPT) mask was useful and would help in saving the world from COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: 17 more deaths, over 1,200 fresh COVID-19 cases in UP
details.content: Uttar Pradesh reported 17 more deaths and over 1,200 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Thursday, taking the state's infection tally to 32,362. So far, 862 deaths have been reported in the state, Additional Chief Secretary and Principal Secretary (Health) Amit Mohan Prasad said.

details.title: Till 8th July, 6,79,831 COVID-19 tests have been conducted in Delhi: Punya Salila Srivastava
details.content: Till 8th July, 6,79,831 COVID-19 tests have been conducted in Delhi, that means 35,780 tests per 10 lakh people. Over 20,000 tests are being conducted daily: Punya Salila Srivastava, Joint Secy, Home Ministry

details.title: WHO has also not provided any standard definition of localised outbreak: Rajesh Bhushan
details.content:
World Health Organization (WHO) has also not provided any standard definition of the localised outbreak and community transmission. They have given its member states the right to report after assessing the local conditions: Rajesh Bhushan, OSD, Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/D6XrDzVb3k

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Air pollution increases risk of COVID-19, deaths: Study
details.content: Air pollution in Bengaluru is linked to the loss of an estimated 6,300 lives in the first half of 2020 and 3.7 per cent decline in the city's annual GDP despite strictly enforcing COVID-19 related lockdown, a study has revealed.

details.title: WATCH | DCGI has permitted two vaccines to go in for phase 1 and 2 clinical trials, says Rajesh Bhushan
details.content:
#WATCH: Bharat Biotech & Cadila Healthcare are developing vaccines. Both vaccines completed animal toxicity studies after approval. DCGI has permitted these 2 vaccines to go in for phase 1 & 2 clinical trials. Trials yet to begin. Hope it begins soon: R Bhushan, Health Ministry pic.twitter.com/ZlgAolTUkY

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Nine new COVID19 positive cases reported in Dharavi
details.content: Nine new COVID19 positive cases reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai today; the total number of positive cases in the area is now 2347 and 86 deaths: BMC

All monuments were allowed to open from July 6 but SOPs are very clear, everyone will have to ensure safety&follow local admn's guidelines. If a monument is in Red zone & state govt disagrees to it, our approval doesn't mean it'll open. State govt's consent essential: Tourism Min pic.twitter.com/xillP4V2MZ

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: CM said that he will write to PM Modi, HM Amit Shah seeking cancellation of exams: Punjab CMO
details.content: Terming the COVID situation in the state non-conducive to conduct of exams, Punjab CM Capt Amarinder said that he will write to PM Modi & Union Home Minister Amit Shah seeking cancellation of exams in universities & colleges in the interest and safety of the students: Punjab CMO

details.title: CM said he will seek revocation of the July 6 MHA orders: Punjab CMO
details.content: Chief Minister said he will seek revocation of the July 6 MHA orders on compulsory conduct of final terms exams in the universities/colleges by September, and withdrawal of the University Grants Commission (UGC) guidelines accordingly: Punjab Chief Minister's Office

details.title: India, UAE allow their airlines to carry people on both legs of charter flights between Jul 12-26
details.content: India and the UAE have agreed to allow their airlines to carry eligible passengers on both legs of their charter flights between the two countries to be operated from July 12 to July 26, the Ministry of Civil Aviation said on Thursday.

details.title: Kids employed as daily wage labourers during COVID-19 lockdown, reveals survey
details.content: According to a survey, 26% boys in Mysuru, 29% in Dharwad (including 9% girls) and 13% in Bengaluru (including 4% girls) have been employed as daily wage labourers during the period of the lockdown (March to June). The children employed as daily wage labourers were high school students. (READ MORE)

details.title: Karnataka approves enhancing contingency fund limit to Rs 500 crore due to COVID
details.content: The Karnataka cabinet on Thursday gave its approval for "The Karnataka Contingency Fund (Amendment) Bill, 2020" to enhance the contingency fund limit to Rs 500 crore in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Kerala Coronavirus Update
details.content:
#coronaupdates #Kerala #July9th

State reported 339 #COVID19 cases on #Thu.

149 were recovered. @xpresskerala @NewIndianXpress

— Dileep V Kumar (@dileepvk_TNIE) July 9, 2020

details.title: India has not yet reached community transmission stage, says government
details.content: Amid a spurt in coronavirus cases, the government on Thursday said India has not yet reached the community transmission stage of COVID-19 and asserted that there have been localised outbreaks in some geographical areas. The Centre's assertion came on a day India registered a record single-day surge of 24,879 COVID-19 cases, taking the caseload to 7,67,296.

details.title: Kerala government to help Travancore, Cochin Devaswom boards tide over lockdown crisis
details.content: The TDB suffered losses worth Rs 200 crore since March 25. Following the relaxation of lockdown measures, 1,248 temples under the board had allowed entry of devotees for a brief period starting from June 9. However, a week later, the ban was reinstated following criticism from various quarters. (READ MORE)

details.title: 15th meeting of India-EU summit will be held in virtual mode on 15 July: MEA
details.content: 15th meeting of India-EU summit will be held in virtual mode on 15 July. It'll be co-chaired by PM, President of European Council&President of European Commission. summit will review India-EU cooperation, also expected to discuss developments around COVID: Anurag Srivastava, MEA

details.title: Chandigarh reports 16 new COVID-19 positive cases in the last 24 hours
details.content:
Chandigarh reports 16 new #COVID19 positive cases in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 523 including 113 active cases and 7 deaths: Chandigarh Administration pic.twitter.com/YjDsjyZgJc

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: The number of recovered cases is 1.75 times the number of active cases: Government of India
details.content: The number of recovered cases has overshot the number of COVID19 active cases by 2,06,588. The number of recovered cases is 1.75 times (almost twice) the number of active cases: Government of India

details.title: Recovery rate increases to 62.09% today
details.content: The recovery rate among COVID-19 patients has increased to 62.09% today: Government of India

details.title: Nizamuddin Markaz: Delhi court grants bail to 76 foreigners from 8 countries
details.content: A Delhi court Thursday granted bail to 76 foreign nationals from 8 countries who were chargesheeted for attending Markaz at Nizamuddin here by allegedly violating visa conditions, indulging in missionary activities illegally and violating government guidelines, issued in the wake of COVID-19 outbreak. (READ MORE)

details.title: Process on to decide about PG MD, MS course exams: Maharashtra government to Bombay HC
details.content: The Maharashtra government on Thursday told the Bombay High Court that it was in the process of taking a decision on conducting final year exams for the post-graduate MD and MS courses amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Amid COVID-19 scare,Intermediate 2nd year supplementary exams cancelled in Telangana
details.content: The Telangana government on Thursday announced cancellation of the intermediate second year supplementary exams and declared every student passed. Education Minister PSabitha Indra Reddy said as many as 1.47 lakh students, who were supposed to appear for the exams, are considered passed and they can now collect their marksheets at their respective colleges by July 31.

details.title: Assam reports two more COVID-19 fatalities, death toll rises to 24
details.content: Assam reported two more COVID-19 fatalities on Thursday, pushing the death toll due to the infection in the state to 24, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

details.title: What is Delhi's 'Test-Track-Treat' strategy?
details.content:
Delhi govt adopts "Test-Track-Treat" strategy for early detection. All state run dispensaries & polyclinics to offer RAT from 9 am to 12 noon @NewIndianXpress #coronavirus #COVID__19 pic.twitter.com/k1SBV2M5t7

— Somrita Ghosh (@Somrita_Ghosh) July 9, 2020

details.title: Tamil Nadu tally stands at 1.26 lakh, samples tested inches towards 15 lakh mark
details.content: Fresh COVID-19 cases again breached the 4,000 mark in Tamil Nadu after a gap of three days and 65 deaths were reported on Thursday, taking the tally to 1.26 lakh and the toll to 1,765. Though the state's daily count of fresh cases soared to 4,231, the downtrend in the fresh infections in the state capital continued with the addition of only 1,216 cases.

details.title: Hit by COVID-19 lockdown, Indian Railways freezes job recruitment
details.content:
India's largest employer, Indian Railways, has decided not to fill any new posts across the country. The move comes following the economic hit COVID-19 has delivered. Last November, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal had announced that the Railways had commenced the process to fill around 2.93 lakh posts. (READ MORE)

For representational purpose. (Photo | PTI)

details.title: TN colleges allowed to collect fees in three instalments for current academic year
details.content: The Tamil Nadu government informed the Madras High Court on Thursday that it has allowed self-financing colleges to collect fees for the present academic year in three instalments. Private schools and colleges in the state had challenged the government order that prohibited them from collecting fees due to the pandemic lockdown. (READ MORE)

details.title: Record spike of 861 takes Gujarat's COVID-19 tally beyond 39,000
details.content: Gujarat reported its highest single-day spike of 861 COVID-19 cases on Thursday, which pushed its overall tally beyond the 39,000-mark, the state health department said. The case count in the state now stands at 39,280, it said. Fifteen patients succumbed to the infection in the last 24 hours, that took the state's death toll to 2,010, the department said in a statement.

details.title: Delhi govt directs hospitals to appoint nodal officers for plasma requisition
details.content: Hospitals in Delhi have been directed to appoint nodal officers for requisition, coordination and issuance of plasma from the 'plasma bank' recently set up at a state-run facility here, officials said. Delhi Chief Arvind Kejriwal on July 2 had inaugurated a first-of-its-kind 'plasma bank' at the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences (ILBS) for the benefit of COVID-19 patients and urged those who have recovered from this disease to donate plasma for other patients.

details.title: COVID-19 situation in Delhi has improved, says Centre; recovery rate stands at 76 per cent
details.content: The COVID-19 situation in the national capital has shown improvement in recent days in both recovery and doubling rates, the Union Home Ministry said on Thursday, while 2,187 fresh cases were reported and the city's coronavirus tally rose to 1,07,051.

details.title: DCGI asks manufacturers to take steps to prevent black-marketing, overpricing of COVID-19 drugs
details.content: In order to prevent black-marketing and overpricing of COVID-19 drugs such as Remdesivir, India's drugs regulator DCGI has asked manufacturers to set up a helpline for patients and also put on their websites details of distributors and supply chain.
